de.iabg.mode
Class ModeTableModel

java.lang.Object
  javax.swing.table.AbstractTableModel
      de.iabg.mode.ModeTableModel
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable, javax.swing.table.TableModel
public class ModeTableModel
extends javax.swing.table.AbstractTableModel
implements javax.swing.table.TableModel

This implementation of a TableModel provides a table representation of a ModeMatrix. This class bridges the connection between a ModeMatrix and a ModeModel by simply adding a table representation. Therefore, some of the methods of this class wrap those in ModeMatrix, while other methods are wrapped in ModeModel. Most of the descriptions of the methods in this class can be found by refering to the API of either of those two classes. The remaining methods generally implement or override those specified in TableModel. Refer to the API or tutorial for using Table Models for more details. This TableModel provides three columns to represent a ModeMatrix: The first is called Selected or On, which selects the corresponding mode shape. Selecting or deselecting this option can allow later calculations, such as the Modal Assurance Criterion to only calculate specified modes. The second column is called Mode ID, which displays the identifier of the mode. The third column is called Frequency [Hz], which displays the frequency of the mode. The rows of this table reflect the total number of modes that are currently stored.

Version:
September 13, 2008
Author:
Adam C. Dick, BSE
